page.title: 02GAVINTON, VILLAGE NEAR DUNS
page.content: GAVINTON IS A SMALL VILLAGE SITUATED ABOUT ONE & A HALF MILES FROM DUNS. IT IS NAMED AFTER DAVID GAVIN,WHO USED TO OWN LANGTON HOUSE,NOW DISMANTLED. HE DIDN'T LIKE HAVING A VILLAGE IN FRONT OF HIS HOUSE SO HE HAD IT REBUILT AT ITS PRESENT SITE. IT WAS NAMED AFTER HIM. THE VILLAGE HAS A SMALL CHURCH WITH A SPIRE & A ROLL OF{190}. A GREEN WITH SWINGS IS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE VILLAGE. MANY YEARS AGO PEOPLE KEPT ANIMALS SUCH AS GOATS & HENS THERE. THERE IS A WALL BESIDE THE GREEN WITH A HOLE FOR THE HENS TO GO THROUGH. THERE ARE THREE VENNELS, ONE CALLED 'SKILL' VENNEL (SKILL = SCHOOL) ANOTHER CALLED BAKER'S VENNEL SHOWING THAT THE VILLAGE USED TO HAVE A BAKERY.THERE WAS A PIGGERY THERE TOO.
